alert.note: Alert for Mobile (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued March 28 at 3:18AM CDT until March 29 at 2:56PM CDT by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 615 AM CDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southwest Alabama, including the following county, Mobile. * WHEN...Until 615 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 315 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area in a rather short period of time. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. Poor drainage areas of downtown and midtown Mobile will likely see heavy ponding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Midtown Mobile, Downtown Mobile, Prichard, I65 And I165, Mobile Regional Airport, Forest Hill, Tacon, West Hill, Wheelerville, Mertz, Orchard and Plateau.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
